briefTitle: Genetic Influences on Response to Gait Rehabilitation in Parkinson's Disease
officialTitle: Genetic Influences on Response to Gait Rehabilitation in Parkinson's Disease

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Meet UK Brain Bank (UKBB) criteria for the diagnosis of PD (modified so that having more than one affected relative was not considered an exclusion criteria)
* Have a Hoehn \& Yahr score of 3
* Have the ability to walk 400 m without physical assistance from a device or another person
* Do not have other health conditions (e.g., orthopedic, cardiopulmonary) that impact the ability to safely participate in a moderately intense gait training program

Exclusion Criteria:

* The investigators will exclude those patients presenting clinical diagnosis of dementia.
* The investigators will exclude those patients presenting conditions (cardiac, renal, or metabolic) that would pose a risk to their health by exercising.

primary.description: The investigators will use the APDM Movement Monitoring system to assess gait speed (m/s) during straight-line walking as a measure of gait function.
primary.timeFrame: measured at baseline, 2 weeks, 10 weeks and 16 weeks

primary.description: The investigators will use the Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA; score range=0-30, with 30 indicating better cognitive function) as a reflection of global cognitive function
primary.timeFrame: measured at baseline and at 10 weeks
